marytts.unitselection.analysis
Class Phone

java.lang.Object
  marytts.unitselection.analysis.Phone

public class Phone
extends java.lang.Object

Convenience class containing the selected units and targets of a phone segment, and a host of getters to access their prosodic attributes

Author:
steiner

Parameters:
leftUnit - which can be null
rightUnit - which can be null
sampleRate - of the TimelineReader containing the SelectedUnits, needed to provide duration information
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if both the left and right units are null

getRightDurationFactor

Get the factor to convert this phone's right unit's duration into this phone's right target duration

Returns:
the right duration factor

getFramewiseDurationFactors

public double[] getFramewiseDurationFactors()
Get the duration factors for this phone, one per datagram. Each factor corresponding to a datagram in the left unit is that required to convert the left unit's duration to the left target duration, and likewise for the right unit's datagrams.

Returns:
the left and right duration factors for this phone, in an array whose size matched the Datagrams in this phone's units

setLeftTargetF0Values

public void setLeftTargetF0Values(double[] f0TargetValues)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Set the target F0 values of this phone's left half, with one value per Datagram in the phone's left unit

Parameters:
f0TargetValues - array of target F0 values to assign to the left halfphone
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of f0TargetValues does not match the number of Datagrams in the phone's left unit

setRightTargetF0Values

public void setRightTargetF0Values(double[] f0TargetValues)

Parameters:
f0TargetValues - array of target F0 values to assign to the right halfphone
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of f0TargetValues does not match the number of Datagrams in the phone's right unit

getLeftUnitFrameDurations

public double[] getLeftUnitFrameDurations()
Get the durations (in seconds) of each Datagram in this phone's left unit

Returns:
the durations of each Datagram in the left unit in an array, or null if there is no left unit

getRightUnitFrameDurations

public double[] getRightUnitFrameDurations()
Get the durations (in seconds) of each Datagram in this phone's right unit

Returns:
the durations of each Datagram in the right unit in an array, or null if there is no right unit

getRealizedFrameDurations

public double[] getRealizedFrameDurations()
Get the durations (in seconds) of each Datagram in this phone's left and right units

Returns:
the durations of all Datagrams in this phone in an array

getLeftUnitFrameF0s

public double[] getLeftUnitFrameF0s()
Recover the F0 values from this phone's left unit's Datagrams

Returns:
the left unit's F0 values in an array, with one value per Datagram, or null if there is no left unit or any of the left unit's Datagrams have zero duration

getRightUnitFrameF0s

public double[] getRightUnitFrameF0s()
Recover the F0 values from this phone's right unit's Datagrams

Returns:
the right unit's F0 values in an array, with one value per Datagram, or null if there is no right unit or any of the right unit's Datagrams have zero duration

getUnitFrameF0s

public double[] getUnitFrameF0s()
Recover the F0 values from each Datagram in this phone's left and right units

Returns:
the F0 values for each Datagram in this phone, or null if either the left or the right unit contain a Datagram with zero duration

getRealizedF0

public double getRealizedF0()
Get the realized F0 by recovering the F0 from all Datagrams in this phone and computing the mean

Returns:
the mean F0 of all Datagrams in this phone's left and right units

getLeftF0Factors

public double[] getLeftF0Factors()
Get the factors to convert each of the F0 values in this phone's left half to the corresponding target value

Returns:
the F0 factors for this phone's left half in an array with one value per Datagram, or null if the number of Datagrams does not match the number of left target F0 values

getRightF0Factors

public double[] getRightF0Factors()
Get the factors to convert each of the F0 values in this phone's right half to the corresponding target value

Returns:
the F0 factors for this phone's right half in an array with one value per Datagram, or null if the number of Datagrams does not match the number of right target F0 values

getF0Factors

public double[] getF0Factors()
Get the F0 factor for each Datagram in this phone's left and right units

Returns:
the F0 factors, in an array with one value per Datagram

isTransient

public boolean isTransient()
Determine whether this is a transient phone (i.e. a plosive)

Returns:
true if this is a plosive, false otherwise

isVoiced

public boolean isVoiced()
Determine whether this is a voiced phone

Returns:
true if this is voiced, false otherwise

getMaryXMLElement

public org.w3c.dom.Element getMaryXMLElement()
get the MaryXML Element corresponding to this Phone's Target

If both leftTarget and rightTarget are not null, their respective MaryXML Elements should be equal.

Returns:
the MaryXML Element, or null if both halfphone targets are null

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
for debugging, provide the names of the left and right targets as the string representation of this class

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
